intro: Eumachia longistylis, commonly known as the long-styled eumachia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers with prominent stamens and a slender style. Its leaves are typically opposite and have a glossy surface. Eumachia longistylis is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories.
